lead_paragraph: The owner of the Predators, Craig Leipold, and representatives of the local group hoping to keep the team in Nashville met yesterday with N.H.L. Commissioner Gary Bettman.Gerry Helper, vice president of communications for the Predators, said Leipold and the group bidding to buy the team were in New York to see Bettman.Herb Fritch, chief executive of HealthSpring Inc. in Nashville and one of the leaders of the local group, did not attend the meeting but confirmed that investors met with Leipold, Bettman and other N.H.L. officials.“Nashville has the opportunity to move very quickly to retain the Predators and to do so under local ownership,” Fritch said.Leipold said he was trying to sell the team after losing $70 million since being awarded the franchise in 1997.
